titleStmt.title: Remedies for diseases in horses Approued and allowed by diuers very auncient learned mareschalles.
titleStmt.author: Malby, Nicholas, Sir, 1530?-1584, attributed name. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: In Paules churchyarde, at the signe of the Lucrece, by Tho. Purfoote,

notesStmt.note: Often wrongly attributed to Sir Nicholas Malby.
Usually bound with an edition of: Malby, Sir Nicholas. A plaine and easie way to remedie a horse that is foundered in his feete.
Imperfect; folded woodcut of horse lacking.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
